column4: anyone have experiance setting up via drivers?ive tried switching vesa to via in xorg but no luck
I had to setup via drivers for my laptop. I used the drivers from the openchrome project personally but I don't know if they would work for you
do you know how to compile source? via is supposed to be supported out of the box in ubuntu however if you have problems you will have to build the drivers from source.
I would suggest getting the svn source and building it
sudo aptitude install build-essential subversion checkinstall
the name would be via right?
I think so it's been a while....if you built it from source it should automaticly install it when you run sudo make install I believe
Then all you do is change vesa to via and restart
speedtest.net will give you a good idea
it's a more point and click solution
thanks that sounds easyer,im form maine we dont go for that math stuff up here...jk
